System description: A hospital infusion pump delivers IV medication to patients.
Controller: a nurse configures dosage, rate, and start/stop timing.
Sensors monitor flow rate, line pressure, and patient ID barcode scans.
Actuators include the pump motor and line clamp that regulate infusion flow.
Feedback is shown on the device display with alarms for occlusion or mismatch.
Safety context: prevent overdose, wrong-patient delivery, and delayed alarms.
Assumptions: staff are trained and prescriptions are verified before infusion.
